product_overview.product_vision: The most credible, professional-grade EVP investigation tool for mobile—transforming smartphones into serious paranormal research equipment that prioritizes signal over noise.
product_overview.target_market: Paranormal investigators, urban explorers, and hobbyists aged 25-55 who value analytical rigor over entertainment gimmicks
product_overview.value_proposition: Unlike novelty ghost hunting apps filled with random word generators and fake sensor readings, EVP Analyzer provides real audio analysis tools—waveform visualization, spectrogram frequency analysis, and systematic investigation logging—that serious researchers trust.
success_metrics: 4.5+ star average rating on both stores

core_features.description: High-quality ambient audio recording with noise-aware sensitivity, optimized for quiet environments and EVP capture
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want to record ambient audio optimized for EVP capture so that I don't miss subtle audio phenomena
acceptance_criteria: Recording starts within 1 second of button press
Audio quality: 44.1kHz sample rate, 16-bit depth minimum
Background recording continues when screen dims
Automatic gain adjustment for quiet environments

core_features.description: Real-time and post-recording waveform visualization with timeline scrubbing and amplitude display
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want to see the audio waveform so that I can visually identify interesting moments in my recording
acceptance_criteria: Live waveform renders during recording at 30fps minimum

core_features.description: Frequency domain visualization showing audio frequencies over time, rendered as a color-coded heatmap
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want to see frequency patterns so that I can identify unusual spectral anomalies
acceptance_criteria: Color mapping: cool (low intensity) to warm (high intensity)
Tap to see exact frequency at any point

core_features.description: Automatic detection and marking of audio anomalies including frequency spikes, noise floor changes, and silence patterns
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want the app to flag unusual audio events so that I can focus my review on potentially interesting moments
acceptance_criteria: Detects sudden frequency spikes (>2 std dev from baseline)
Identifies noise floor shifts (ambient level changes)
Tap marker to jump to that moment

core_features.description: Review isolated audio clips, replay segments, and add notes/interpretations to specific moments
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want to tag and annotate interesting moments so that I can build a documented record of my findings
acceptance_criteria: Select any segment of recording for focused review
Add text notes to any timestamp
Tag clips with categories (voice, noise, unknown, etc.)
View all tags in scrollable list

core_features.description: Complete history of investigation sessions with location, date, notes, and tagged clips
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want to maintain a log of all my sessions so that I can track my investigations over time
acceptance_criteria: Optional location tagging (GPS or manual entry)
List view of all sessions, sorted by date
Search sessions by location or notes
Session summary shows clip count and duration

core_features.description: Export audio clips as standard audio files for sharing or further analysis in external tools
core_features.user_story: As an investigator, I want to export my clips so that I can share evidence or analyze it with other software
acceptance_criteria: Export individual clips as WAV or M4A
Include metadata (date, location, notes) in export

steps: App shows Investigation Dashboard with 'Start Investigation' button
Recording begins with live waveform display
Session saved, user directed to Analysis view
User scrubs timeline to find interesting moments
User taps anomaly markers to jump to events
User adds tags and notes to clips
User shares or saves to files
